ratings.comment: Lectures and discussions are very boring and pointless. The canvas page is highly unorganized and the syllabus was not posted until halfway into the course. Absences will often not be excused despite having a doctor's note. TA, Francisco Ley is highly unprofessional in his email responses. Not a hard course but not one that you will ever enjoy.

If someone has a bad ratemy don't think you'll have a different experience. You won't, and you'll be mad you took this class. It makes no sense and Lazarian does not care about it at all. He spent 15 minutes of each lecture talking about covid stats. He urged us to say we have HIV to get the booster earlier (it was available to students already).

Professor Lazarian is incredibly rude and confusing in his email responses, even if you just ask a simple question... Discussions were completely pointless, lectures were always super boring and difficult to follow. Could not tell you one thing I learned in this class.

Lectures were boring and unclear and professor never provided any feedback on homework or exams even if questions were asked. Very very difficult course if science or math (chemistry, physics, calculus) is not your thing.

Professor Lazarian spent up to ten minutes each lecture talking about covid and politics. The midterms and final were multiple choice, fairly simple, and 90% of the grade. Despite his claims, reading the textbook felt unnecessary to me, and the lectures were quite boring.

Lazarian's accent is hard to understand & he's disorganized. Lectures cover pretty random material & discussions are useless. Homework is entirely quizlet questions which are often repeated on exams. The 3 exams aren't too difficult but are worth 90% of your grade. The class is easy to pass but you won't learn much without self studying.

Zero structure. No weekly readings, just expected to come to class to figure out what youre focusing on. Spends 5-15 minutes every class to talk about COVID-19. Its an easy class to pass if you memorize quizlet terms. The exam had material not covered in lecture or discussion. Basically teaching yourself

It's not a bad course if you want to get an introduction/ overview of astronomy. The professor clearly enjoys his field and presents with a passion. If you're ambivalent towards astronomy, I would recommend taking this class. You might find yourself thinking more about it afterwards.

Not sure what he would be like in person, but not good at teaching an online class and keeping students engaged. Exams were weighted 90% in an online class during COVID-19, not the most accommodating. TA's weren't helpful either
